Job Title: Full stack Integration Engineer (Azure Logic Apps, React, AI)
Salary: Up to $175k base + super + bonus + shares
Ad Text:
Location: Sydney (Hybrid, 4 days in office)
Salary: Up to $175k  base + super + bonus + shares

We are looking for an Enterprise Solutions Engineer to join our enterprise systems team in Sydney. This is a hands-on engineering role where you will design, prototype, and deliver internal tools and integrations that directly support over 250 restaurants and 10,000 staff across the country.

You’ll work across Azure Logic Apps, Function Apps, React/TypeScript, and modern AI-augmented development environments such as Cursor, Copilot, and LangChain. The role suits an engineer who enjoys rapid prototyping, building practical solutions, and seeing their work make an immediate impact in a live operational environment.

What you’ll do

Prototype in Azure Logic Apps and refine into Function Apps for scale and performance
Build and integrate solutions using React / TypeScript
Use AI-augmented tools (Cursor, Copilot, LangChain, AutoGen) to accelerate development
Deliver end-to-end solutions from prototype through to production
Work across both Azure and AWS depending on hosting context
Build tools that are directly used by franchise owners, store managers, and operational staff
What you’ll bring

Proficiency with React / TypeScript
Experience with Azure Logic Apps / Function Apps
Familiarity with AI-enhanced development (Cursor, Copilot, LangChain, RAG)
A track record of delivering solutions independently and at pace
Strong problem-solving skills and a product mindset
Why join

Hybrid, 4 days office in Surry Hills
10% annual bonus
5% shares each year (vesting over 3)
5 weeks annual leave
$250 annual gift card + $100/month phone allowance
New Surry Hills office near Central Station

Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Data & AI team as a ML/AI Engineer.  If you’re a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we’d love you to apply. 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. As a ML/AI Engineer at Australian Retirement Trust, you will play a pivotal role in developing and deploying advanced machine learning and AI solutions that drive strategic decision-making and enhance member experience. You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and deliver impactful data-driven insights. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of superannuation through innovative technology in a purpose-driven organisation.

 

 

Day to day, you'll: 

Develop, build, and maintain segmentation, predictive models, forecasting, and AI-driven solutions to meet business needs and improve outcomes.
Deploy AI solutions that integrate with enterprise systems to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience.
Analyse internal and external data using statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover trends in ART and the broader superannuation industry.
Automate and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI models, ensuring seamless integration and continuous delivery of updates.
Monitor AI system performance in production, proactively identifying and resolving issues to maintain accuracy and efficiency.
Conduct exploratory data analysis on structured and unstructured data to uncover new opportunities and insights.
Communicate findings and recommendations through clear documentation, visualisations, and stakeholder engagement.
Ensure compliance with ART’s data and AI governance and reporting standards.

This role is a permanent opportunity. 

📍 Location: Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne. 

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

Tertiary qualifications in Mathematics, Data/Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience using machine learning and AI to solve business problems, preferably in financial services.
Proficiency in SQL and Python/R, ideally within a cloud environment (e.g., Databricks on Azure/AWS).
Strong knowledge of data models and data mining techniques.
Demonstrated analytical, modelling, and data mining skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proven ability to analyse and apply customer information to generate actionable insights.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present solutions to stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within and across multi-disciplinary teams. 

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you’ll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close 11:30pm 16 October 2025. 

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

Job Title: Data and Analytics Engineer - 12-month max. term contract
Ad Text:
Data and Analytics Engineer - 12-month max. term contract


The National Breast Cancer Foundation (NBCF) is Australia's leading not-for-profit organisation funding world-class breast cancer research towards our vision of Zero Deaths from breast cancer.
Newly created role, leverage analytical and technical skills to implement innovative solutions; work with empowering manager, Head of Data and Insights.
Hybrid work environment, NFP salary packaging, and an opportunity to work with a passionate team in a mission-driven organisation.
About our client
  
The National Breast Cancer Foundation (NBCF) is Australia's leading not-for-profit organisation funding world-class breast cancer research towards their vision of Zero Deaths from breast cancer. 

Since their inception in 1994, NBCF has invested over $200M into more than 600 world-class research projects across Australia. In this time, death rate from breast cancer in Australia has improved by 40%. 

They've seen remarkable results, but the job's not done. 

At NBCF, they’re determined to create a better tomorrow. They know research matters, and it is central and critical to improving breast cancer outcomes. That’s why they fund the very best breast cancer research in Australia by awarding grants via an open national, competitive, and rigorous peer review process.

With a talented and committed team and an enviable reputation, NBCF is well-positioned to achieve even greater outcomes over the coming years and change the future for all those diagnosed with breast cancer.


Role responsibilities

You will report to the Head of Data and Analytics and work closely in a small team, to design and deliver trusted, scalable data models and solutions that empower the organisation to make smarter, faster, and more impactful decisions. You’ll do this by building robust integrations, pipelines, automating workflows, and enabling self-service analytics to ensure that high-quality data is accessible, reliable, and aligned to business needs.
  
You’ll support a culture of strong data governance and insight, to help maximise the value of fundraising, finance, and donor data.


Partner with stakeholders to understand data and analytics requirements, translating them into technical solutions supporting data models, reports, automated workflows, and campaign activities.
Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines across systems of record (including CRM, fundraising, and MarTech systems) and an Azure Data Warehouse.
Ingest data from CRM, finance, fundraising, and MarTech systems into the Azure Data Lake and Data Warehouse.
Cleanse, normalise, and join datasets to create reusable data models and analytics-ready views of organisational data.
Leverage Azure Data Lake and related tools to support scalable data preparation and storage.
Use Python (including writing automation scripts), SQL, Power Automate, and/or KNIME to streamline workflows, automate recurring extracts and reporting, and reduce manual effort.
Develop APIs and integrations that connect CRM, finance, MarTech, and the data warehouse seamlessly.
Create reusable data models and semantic layers that power self-service analytics and consistent reporting. Define key metrics and build dashboards in BI tools to drive better decisions.
Support data retrievals for campaign analytics (target audience lists, response tracking, ROI measurement, etc).
Implement data quality checks, deduplication processes, metadata management, and security standards to ensure reliable, trusted data.
Business partner internally to encourage best practise data governance.
  
The successful candidate
  
You are a natural problem solver and collaborator, who is able to manage competing priorities in a dynamic environment. You’ll be able to build strong relationships and communicate effectively to a variety of technical and non-technical stakeholders, and have the confidence and technical experience to suggest and drive creative solutions to existing issues.
  

A Bachelor’s degree in Data Engineering, Data Science, or a related field as well as experience in a hybrid data engineering/analytics engineering role.
Exceptional SQL skills, experience with ETL and data transformation tools (e.g., dbt, Alteryx, custom scripts, or similar).
Proven experience with Python (or another scripting language) for automation.
Experience with at least one Data Warehouse platform (e.g., Azure SQL/Synapse, Redshift, or BigQuery), as well as experience working with CRM platforms and related data models
Strong experience working with at least one BI tool (Power BI preferred but can also be Tableau or Looker)
Ability to bridge engineering and business systems
Experience implementing data quality checks, metadata management, or data governance practices.
Robust NFP experience - or transferrable industry experience (e.g., Telecommunications, Sales, FMCG, or similar sectors).
  
How to Apply

To be considered for this position please apply now with your resume directly through the advertisement. If you have any further questions, please contact Diana Linde at diana@beaumontpeople.com.au.
  
Closing date: Friday October 10th, 2025. Applications will be assessed the following week.

At Beaumont People we believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way.  We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities.
  
We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.

Data Engineer

At Elula, we partner with some of Australia's top financial institutions to tackle a wide range of business challenges through cutting-edge AI-as-a-service (AIaaS). Our vision? To make the complex simple and easy, delivering amazing customer experiences and personalisation that matters.

Our products leverage machine learning, productionised models, data pipelines, explainable AI, and rich visualisations to drive customer engagement, retention and insights. We're constantly pushing the envelope, uncovering the ever-evolving needs of customers and staying ahead of the curve.

Join a team of some of the brightest minds in data science and engineering; experts with years of experience and a passion for delivering smarter decision-making. It's a fast-paced, high-performing and collaborative environment where creativity and learning take centre stage, and the work is as fun as it is rewarding.

Find out more about us at https://elula.ai/team/.




The role

As a Data Engineer at Elula, you will play a key role in building and maintaining the data that powers our AI-as-a-Service platform. You will design, implement, and optimise data pipelines, models and tools, ensuring that our data is accurate, reliable, and scalable. You’ll collaborate closely with data scientists, software engineers, and customer-facing teams working end-to-end across the data lifecycle, from ingestion and modelling through to validation and delivery.

We're looking for someone who jumps at the opportunity to work autonomously on open-ended problems and thrives in an environment where collaboration, ambition, and excellence is paramount. Our ideal candidate is a stellar communicator, able to connect with all types of people, who puts their hand up, takes ownership, and is never afraid to ask for help when needed.
 

Minimum Skills & Experience

If you have the following skills and experience, we encourage you to apply.

Practical experience working with data, through projects or professional roles

Strong analytical skills, with the ability to explore, clean, and transform data to make it usable

Proficiency in SQL for querying, joining, and aggregating data

Experience in a programming language (preferably Python) for data wrangling and automation

Exposure to data pipelines or ETL processes, with an eagerness to learn best practices for building and maintaining them

Familiarity with data modelling concepts and how data is structured for analysis

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain findings and collaborate with teammates across engineering and data science

Curiosity and problem-solving mindset, with a willingness to learn new tools and techniques




Preferred Skills & Experience

While the following are not required, they are highly valued.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or similar

Hands-on experience with:

Databases (Presto, PostgreSQL, etc.) and SQL

Distributed data processing frameworks such as Spark/PySpark

Applying data modelling and data management principles in practice

Building and maintaining Python packages or reusable libraries

Optimising query performance and ensuring data pipeline reliability

Writing tests (unit, integration, and end-to-end) to validate data and code quality

Using version control systems (e.g. Git) for collaborative development

Familiarity with agile ways of working (sprints, huddles, retros, etc.)




Benefits

Elula’s people are at the core of all we do. Our benefits are just one way we show that.

Enjoy flexible working hours, and work from home two days per week, to better balance your personal and professional life.

Experience the freedom of working anywhere in Australia up to five days annually.

Give back to what matters to you with extra paid annual leave for volunteering.

Put your health first with an allowance for fitness and wellbeing.

Drive your development with financial support for approved training courses.

Level up with matched funding for career coaching.




Interested?

If you're excited about shaping the future of AI, this is where you belong! Submit your CV and cover letter telling us why you're the right fit for Elula and what makes you special!

We're committed to fostering a culture of inclusivity and equality. All are welcome to apply for our roles because we truly believe that diversity is a game changer.

AI Implementation Specialist Full-time, 6 months duration (with possible 12-month extension).

POSITION DETAILS The AI Implementation Specialist will:

Coordinate and deliver activities identified in the AI Implementation Accelerator roadmap
Collaborate with a specialised AI consultancy to implement recommendations, including enterprise AI strategy, governance frameworks, and capability models.
Develop and implement policies, processes, and guidelines to support ethical and compliant use of AI technologies
Design and facilitate AI literacy programs in partnership with People & Culture
Work across stakeholders to identify and prioritise AI related use cases.
Support the design and execution of AI pilots for prioritised use cases including defining success measures and reporting outcomes.
Coordinate the establishment and operation of an executive-level AI and Data decision-making body, ensuring effective governance and decision-making.
Prepare business cases and documentation to secure funding and support for future phases of the AI implementation program.
Engage and manage stakeholders across faculties and business units to ensure enterprise-wide adoption and alignment of AI initiatives.
Monitor and report on progress, risks, and benefits of AI implementation activities, ensuring compliance with relevant legislation, regulations.
Champion a culture of innovation and responsible AI adoption, promoting awareness of ethical, social, and environmental considerations in AI use.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Advanced expertise in enterprise AI strategy, governance, prioritisation and implementation.
Workshop and AI literacy training design and facilitation.
Strong stakeholder engagement and change management skills.
Demonstrated ability to design and deliver innovative AI solutions, pilots, and capability uplift initiatives.
Deep knowledge of AI technologies, data governance, and compliance requirements.
Experience developing policies and frameworks for emerging technologies.
Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to engage executive stakeholders.
Proven ability to manage complex projects and deliver outcomes in a dynamic environment.

If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Shilpa Kunhikannan Sreeja at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 430 294 828.

At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.

We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

We’re looking for an AI Engineer to join a small, agile IT team and play a hands-on role in transforming the way our organisation works. This is your opportunity to design, develop, and maintain automation workflows and AI-powered solutions that enhance both operational efficiency and the overall user experience.

You'll be at the forefront of innovation—working across Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, Power Platform, and Azure Cloud Services to streamline processes, reduce manual work, and build scalable, intelligent systems.

What you’ll be doing:
Build & optimise automation using Power Automate, Azure Logic Apps, and low-code tools (e.g., n8n.io).
Design & deploy AI-based solutions with Azure AI Services to improve decision-making and productivity.
Integrate platforms & systems, ensuring seamless interoperability between Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Azure, and third-party tools.
Deliver project support, especially for automation, integration, and AI-focused initiatives.
Provide general IT support, application troubleshooting, and engage with end users to resolve issues.
Champion continuous improvement, identifying opportunities to evolve our systems, processes, and tools.
Maintain system security & governance in line with compliance and data protection standards.
Contribute to a positive team culture, bringing energy, initiative, and collaboration to everything you do.
What we’re looking for:
You’re someone who thrives in a hands-on role within a small team, enjoys solving problems, and loves bringing smart tech solutions to life.

Essential experience:
Microsoft Power Automate & Power Platform
Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM
Azure Cloud Services (Functions, App Services, Storage, etc.)
REST APIs & integration workflows
Low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., n8n.io)
Nice to have:
Insurance industry experience
Experience with Azure DevOps & CI/CD pipelines
Exposure to AI/ML tools or concepts
Relevant Microsoft Certifications (e.g., Power Platform, Azure Fundamentals)
What you’ll bring:
Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
A growth mindset with a passion for learning and tech innovation
A team-first attitude—ready to collaborate, share, and support others

If you're ready to make an impact with automation and AI in a hands-on, versatile role, click Apply now or send your cv direct to greg.perl@pra.com.au

Category:
Engineering - Network (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
UC Engineer (Health Manager Level 3) 

Permanent full-time opportunity
In-office presence with hybrid flexibility | Chatswood or Charlestown
Attractive salary, up to $144,444.00 + 12% Super + 17.5% annual leave loading
Accrue 12 extra days off + 4 weeks annual leave per year
Join the team enriching health in millions of ways every day through digital innovation

Applications Close: 11:59pm, 15th October 2025
 

Join our Unified Communication Group as an Engineer (Core Platforms & Applications)
In this role you will help integrate enterprise communication tools - voice, SMS, video conferencing, and clinical apps - into a seamless, user-friendly platform enhancing productivity across NSW Health.

You’ll support Core Platforms, Applications & Services: Delivering statewide voice, conferencing, mobile, and messaging services

Your focus will be on developing and enhancing Unified Telephony solutions, primarily Microsoft Teams Phone System and Internet Protocol Telephony (TIPT). You’ll gather customer needs, conduct research, and collaborate across teams to deliver innovative UC and Telehealth solutions for both corporate and clinical users.
 

In this role, you will:

Lead technical expertise and support for UC systems, including Microsoft Teams Phone, IP Telephony (TIPT), and telephony devices.
Drive the transition from legacy telephony to modern cloud-based solutions, ensuring seamless deployment and adoption.
Create clear technical documentation and troubleshooting guides to empower teams and users.
Conduct rigorous testing, validation, and root cause analysis to maintain solution reliability and quality.
Collaborate with customers and stakeholders to deliver products on time, innovate, and optimize performance.
Provide ongoing technical support, including participation in on-call rotations, and manage incident resolution via ITIL processes.

This role is internally referred to as Engineer – Service Management.

About You

We are looking for someone with:

Proven experience managing large-scale Statewide Voice Services and UC platforms (Microsoft Teams, IP Telephony) in complex environments, ideally within NSW Health.
Strong expertise with VoIP, SIP Trunks, PSTN, desk phones, telephony devices, and cloud-based UC solutions (AWS/Azure).
Skilled in vendor and telco management, including procurement, service delivery, billing, and ongoing enhancements.
Comfortable working in Agile environments with experience mentoring peers, creating product stories, and driving roadmap delivery.
Excellent communicator with knowledge of contact centre systems, call recording, video conferencing, and project management principles. 

Need more information?

Position description
Find out how we hire at eHealth NSW 
Check out our diversity and inclusion commitment 
Learn more about us at eHealth NSW

Working at eHealth
Our people are at the heart of who we are. We support our people with great benefits so they can enrich health in millions of ways every day:

Flexible work options
Professional growth and career development
Allocated day off per month
Salary packaging 
Various health and wellbeing programs to support our team

How to apply
Share with us your cover letter and most up to date resume (up to 5 pages), highlighting your relevant skills and experience.

We recognise that AI tools are increasingly being used to assist with resumes and applications. While we accept their use, we’re eager to see your personality and get to know the person behind the application!

For further discussions around the role or recruitment process, including adjustments, please contact our Talent Advisor, Hayley Cheng, or Hiring Manager, James Pill, and quote REQ609823.

Additional information

This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months. 
To be eligible for this role you must have current Australian work rights (Australian citizen, permanent resident, New Zealand citizen with a current passport, or hold a valid visa with permission to work in Australia).
If you currently reside outside NSW, please confirm in your application your willingness to relocate if successful.

Job Title: AWS Senior Platform Engineer - AI- Major Bank
Ad Text:
A major bank is seeking an AWS Senior Platform Engineer to join their Gen AI engineering team. This is a 12 month contract highly likely to extend.

Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems on AWS.
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment and scaling of AI models and infrastructure.
Experimenting with emerging AI assisted engineering tools and cloud services, providing feedback and insights from real world testing
Building platforms and tools to meet the highest possible quality standards while simultaneously balancing security, performance, availability, and maintainability concernsDesign and implement cloud-native solutions for deploying, managing, and scaling AI models across AWS infrastructure.
Key Skills / Experience:


Proven experience as an AWS Platform Engineer
Demonstrable experience in designing and implementing scalable, maintainable and reliable platforms
Working knowledge of AI/ML and Gen AI applications and how they can enhance platform engineering processes to improve productivity
Experience with nuanced AI/ML-based tools, such as Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker,
Experience with monitoring, logging and debugging
Proven experience as an AWS Platform Engineer
Exposure supporting RAGs using LlamaIndex, LangChain, or similar frameworks. 
Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, TypeScript or C#) and experience supporting microservices architecture on AWS
 
If interested please respond ASAP with your latest resume

About the Company:

OutcomeCatalyst is your data infrastructure partner for faster, smarter investment decisions. We help investment firms and capital markets teams automate the most painful parts of their data stack, from ingesting unstructured documents and onboarding third-party data to deploying AI-powered agents for research, modeling, and decision workflows. Whether you're a $100M hedge fund, a global investment bank, or anything in between, we build reusable, low-lift solutions that accelerate signal generation with zero disruption to your existing systems or processes. From automated data pipelines to front-end copilots, we help you scale insight with less overhead and more conviction.

About the Job:

We're building a dedicated AI safety function to ensure our AI systems align with human values and operate as intended. Reporting to the Head of Architecture, Engineering & Data, you will ensure AI systems are developed and deployed safely. You will work closely with engineers and stakeholders to integrate safety considerations throughout the AI development lifecycle.

> Develop and implement safety and security protocols, monitoring systems, and tools to detect and mitigate potential harms.

> Conduct risk assessments to identify hazards and vulnerabilities in AI systems.

> Design and integrate safety-critical features directly into AI systems.

> Build and maintain safety infrastructure including monitoring and management platforms.

> Explore, and assist with compliance to, safety regulations and standards.

> Investigate safety incidents, analyse root causes, and implement corrective actions.

> Develop technical guardrails including input validation, output filtering, and hallucination detection.

> Implement adversarial robustness testing and bias detection mechanisms.

> Monitor AI system anomalies and performance drift.

> Build RAG systems and validation frameworks for accurate AI outputs.

> Collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout the AI development lifecycle.

> Stay current with AI safety research and best practices Document safety protocols and maintain audit trails.

> Train teams on AI safety and risk mitigation and contribute to organisational policies and governance frameworks.

> Implement guardrail frameworks (Guardrails AI, NeMo Guardrails) to ensure safe AI operations.


About you:

Desirable skills and commercial experience

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.

3-5 years' experience in machine learning, deep learning, and AI development.

Passionate about AI Safety, understanding safety principles, including risk assessment and hazard identification.

Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including fine-tuning and evaluation.

Experience with reinforcement learning safety, RAG systems, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure).

Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.

Proven ability to deliver in complex environments.

Financial services experience.
